captions.text: We play League of Legends for fun,
and it's usually more fun when we win.
It takes a lot to succeed in LoL,
and games are won with more than individual skill and reflexes.
Your ability to coordinate as a team has a significant impact on a game's outcome.
In fact, sportsmanlike players win over 1.7 million more games than average players every day.
Teamwork plays a bigger role in League than you might think.
Let's take a closer look at how it can impact YOUR game.
Say you start a game and one of your teammates gives up a few early kills.
Before you know it, he's throwing a tantrum.
Now you've got a choice:
You COULD go full 5-year old on him: yell and scream and give him hell...
because, of course, THAT'LL help the situation improve.
What some players fail to understand is epic comebacks don't come from berating your teammates.
Rage doesn't win games.
Each negative player on a team decreases your chances of winning...
from a 54% average win rate with 0 ragers,
down to a 46% win rate with 3...
and it keeps getting worse from there.
So, it makes more sense to focus on winning.
Help your teammate out,
buy some wards or concentrate on your lane and keep tempers from flaring in chat.
Players who keep their team focused win more games -
players who fight fire with fire sabotage their own chances at winning.
Sportsmanship and teamwork win games.
The impact of teamwork can be tracked in real-time, too.
You just have to follow the gold.
Our early findings suggest a direct correlation between a team's behavior and the gold they're capable of earning in a match.
In this case, things start going downhill after a failed gank.
One player decides the other is a n00b and flies off the handle.
Meanwhile, the opposing team stays focused, which means they can grab objectives.
More objectives, more gold.
More gold, more needlessly large items.
More needlessly large items, more GG.
The power of teamwork can even be traced down to the individual level.
Players with a record of positive behavior win 10% more games than the average joe.
On the other hand, a player with a report history will on average go on to win 35% fewer games.
It's pretty clear: teams that help each other through tough scrapes are much more likely to win.
So, next time you're looking for a win in League, just remember:
Teamwork OP.

comments.author: r4b1dman

comments.text:
Dear Riot,

I have finally decided to uninstall League of Legends from my computer and 
I have no plans of playing League ever again. I will also discourage people 
from playing this game. I will admit, I love playing LoL, the game play, 
the art, everything about it is amazing. What I dislike about LoL has 
always been it's community-- specifically the toxic players/flamers. I 
don't even mind those that troll or go afk. Sure they are annoying, but 
those players that flame at you and blame you for their deaths even if it's 
clearly their fault, those are the worse example of humanity. I was just in 
a normal game today, and in champ select, these two guys wanted to duo at 
the bot lane, even if I get the first pick and called for support. I told 
myself, "I'll be a team player and just go mid and let these two guys go 
bot lane.". In game, the enemy mid laner kept roaming bot lane because I 
was winning my lane. I have called mia on several occasions, roamed (maybe 
once or twice), and even pinked their lane, but they kept dying (because 
they obviously weren't looking at the map or were too busy to notice the 
pings I have been sending out). Of course, I did not want to roam together 
with the enemy mid lane because I wanted to focus on my lane as well, I was 
thinking I already provided them the wards necessary and pinged them, they 
should know what to do. It would have been advantageous for the whole team 
since I would be able to get the cs and xp advantage and maybe get a turret 
(after which I could roam myself), while the enemy mid laner would be 
wasting her time roaming. Of course, I was thinking my bot lane would play 
safe since necessary warnings were already called (not to mention my pink 
ward). 

So after they have died a million times, my bot lane went agro on me 
because I fed the enemy mid lane. How can I be feeding when they were the 
one dying all the time? They were saying nasty things to me, blaming me. 
I'm a patient person, but there are certain things people should not saying 
against me or else I will fight back so I did. I will admit, I did stoop to 
their level. I said nasty things to them too, and I feel horrible that I 
did that. My point here is, your game, no matter how nice it is, it turns 
good people into rude people. And you obviously have done nothing about it 
(especially in the OCE server). I don't ever want to say those things to 
anyone again. So I think it is wiser for me to uninstall the game. Again, I 
think you did a good job with the game play, the concept, the art, 
everything about the game. It's your community that is the worse. I have 
played similar games before, I played DoTA and DoTA2, but your community is 
the worse community. Honestly, I think (majority) of the people who play 
your game are the worse example of humankind. I wish you change your 
system, but I will never play League again.﻿

What you guys don't understand about your crappy matchmaking system is that 
in every team there is always a retard that never listens to a more 
experienced teammate, or goes alone in TEAMfights. How about you, the 
developpers of a game that is classified as most played f2p MOBA, make 
propper matchmaking that is NOT based on the Elo system( mostly used in 1v1 
strategy games like chess or starcraft) but in how the player progresses 
through the game. League is a 5v5 player game, I find it highly unfair for 
one player, that shows potential and wants a competent team, to recieve a 
teammate that pulls him behind even more.﻿

comments.text:
Teamwork OP indeed, but not cause it wins you games, quite the opposite. 
 You can have 5 really tough enemies and it could be fine, but one clueless 
teammate and the game is pretty much done.  This is because league has 
changed from "Who got better players" to "Who makes less mistakes".  With 
that sense, each teammate you get is another uncertainty.  It could be a 
decent player or a clueless one.  If you get a decent one on all 4 chances, 
good for you, but if you even get 1/4 clueless player, its pretty much gg﻿

comments.text:
Too bad Polish people cant understand the word "Teamwork" even if you hit 
them with a dictionary in the face... I quit league because I lost too many 
games of polish kids who cry for mid and top, me (as a good person) let 
them take the lane even if I chose it first (and i am talking about those 
"Mid/top or feed" guys), he starts feeding... goes 0/11 and then goes AFK 
or just continues to feed their entire team...seriously riot needs to add a 
"vote kick player from match" or a "discontinue game(if the game is before 
15 min or something)" if someone starts to troll... I began to ask where 
people were from at champ select screen and if someone said "PL" (Poland) I 
leave the game at champ selection screen... In all my years of playing 
league I saw JUST ONE person from poland who was actually GOOD at the game 
and he was the captain of our team... I assure you if Riot puts a poll for 
EUNE servers "Should we create a LoL server only for Polish people, (move 
accounts from other servers to the polish one if your IP is polish and all 
that)?" more than 99% of the votes will be "HELL YEAH, FINALLY!" Sorry good 
polish players, i know you are there somewhere... but you are not a lot. 
Riot should put players with a good match history, who were not reported 
and etc. on one team and all the haters, flamers and etc. on another 
team... or make them just 5 haters vs 5 afk-ers and so on... make bad 
players play with bad players... dont put someone with a flawless history 
in a team with 4 people who can barely use a mouse and can barely speak 
english... Do you even Matchmake, RIOT ?﻿

Last season, I was placed into Bronze V. I had only been playing League for 
about 2-3 months, and so was not so great. But, at the end of the season, 
about 9 month later, I made it into Gold V. I moved up two entire tiers, 
and I credit that largely to my ability to communicate and cooperate with 
my teammates, I play positively. I definitely believe that Teamwork Is OP!﻿

comments.author: John Ho

comments.text:
Everyone raging in the comments. Think of a problem you may have in real 
life, however, because of other people, not yourself. Can't find one? Don't 
be surprised. The reason you're stuck in this imaginary ELO hell, is 
because you belong there. LoL is a team game, and all bronzies need to 
accept that. There is nothing you can do against a team 1 v 5, no matter 
how hard you try. Teamwork should be made an effort to be mandatory in 
games. More pings, more wards. You go 0/4? Don't blame mid "OH, NO MIA MID, 
BRONZE 5 GG". Buy a ward. 75 gold saves 300, 600, maybe even 1000 gold from 
the other team. This video is so damn accurate it's almost unreal. Bronze 
players, I'm sure watch it once, believe they understand it, and leave. I'm 
in Platinum 5, and all I can say is honestly, watch this again. Watch it 
twice. Watch it 4 times. Get it through your brain that rage is useless, 
wards re important, and teamwork really is OP. GG guys.﻿

comments.author: Addti ime tracer

comments.text:
some players do have the tendency to fly off the handle at the first 
mistake. Or at least, the first perceived mistake.

Some players become jaded at the idea that people will just fuck them over 
anyway, so they end up adding to the problem that frustrated them to begin 
with. Because "Hey, if they're just going to troll me, I might as well 
screw around, because there's no chance in winning."

Some players just don't want to take an honest look at themselves when they 
make a mistake. Their pride simply will not allow it. To vent out their 
frustration on the matter, they will simply attempt to imprint their 
problems on the other players. That's why some players end up giving wild 
accusations to other players with practically nothing to back it up. The 
frustrated players don't feel like they need to back up their accusations, 
because to them, "fuck you" is the be-all end-all response.

It only gets worse when you add fuel to the fire. "Be water."﻿
